Line 121: Line 121:
The nearby Sand Section is notable for its pockets of quiet neighborhoods adjacent to the ocean. Multi-million dollar ocean-front homes line the bike path and walking lane along The Strand.
The nearby Sand Section is notable for its pockets of quiet neighborhoods adjacent to the ocean. Multi-million dollar ocean-front homes line the bike path and walking lane along The Strand.
â   â
===Locale===
  â
Manhattan Beach is considered to be among the most desirable cities in Los Angeles County because of its climate, beach, excellent schools, low crime rate, freeway proximity and cleaner air than more inland areas.
  â   â
City zoning provides for lenient dwelling-to-land coverage. Much of Manhattan Beach's housing stock has been remodeled from small, single-family, post-WWII era starter-homes, into larger residences.
 
====Downtown====
====Downtown====
Line 147: Line 142:
==Parks and recreation==
==Parks and recreation==
â
The Strand path and bikeway along the beach is popular for [[biking]], [[jogging]], [[roller blading]], and [[skateboarding]]. Volleyball nets are set up along the beach, and swimming, [[body boarding]] and [[surfing]] are popular among residents and visitors. At Manhattan Beach you are allowed to surf at the [[Manhattan Beach Pier]], and the area around 26th street. Surfers can also go up to [[El Porto Beach]] for surfing. Manhattan Beach is considered the birthplace of beach volleyball and Mira Costa High School, has long been known for its outstanding volleyball program.
+
The Strand path and bikeway along the beach is popular for [[biking]], [[jogging]], [[roller blading]], and [[skateboarding]]. Volleyball nets are set up along the beach, and swimming, [[body boarding]] and [[surfing]] are popular among residents and visitors. At Manhattan Beach you are allowed to surf at the [[Manhattan Beach Pier]], and the area around 26th street. Surfers can also go up to [[El Porto Beach]] for surfing.
